Legal_Issue: Whether the Canadian Human Rights Commission erred in dismissing allegations 3 to 6 as out of time
Evidence_Assessment: Applicant's reasons for delay in filing
Decision_Outcome: Complaint dismissed as out of time
Credibility_Factor: Applicant's personal reasons and pursuit of alternate recourse
Legal_Rule: Paragraph 41(1)(e) of the Canadian Human Rights Act
Grounds_for_Claim: Discrimination by RCMP leading to dismissal
Outcome_on_Merits: Not reached; dismissed on procedural grounds
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Commission's assessment of delay found reasonable
Key_Evidence_Considered: Date of dismissal (December 19, 2001), date of complaint filing (October 24, 2003), applicant's explanation for delay
Legal_Framework: Human rights complaint process under federal law
Applicant_Challenge: Commission's refusal to accept late filing
Standard_of_Proof: Preponderance of evidence / sufficient justification for delay
Defendant_Response: Not explicitly stated, but Commission upheld procedural timeline
Authority: Canadian Human Rights Commission, Federal Court
Legal_Provision_Cited: s. 41(1)(e) of the Canadian Human Rights Act
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Complaint filed beyond one-year limit without sufficient justification
Applicable_Process: Filing and review of human rights complaints
Governing_Rule: Time limit for filing complaints under the Canadian Human Rights Act
